title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: W. Storer How to Orlando Brown, October 5, 1865
summary: How files a report detailing the completed organization of the Sixth District, which Headquarters will shortly move from Staunton to Winchester. In his report, he observes some problems in providing poor relief, especially for women with many children, and the continued adjustment of blacks to their new status in society.
keywords: Administration/Bureaucracy, Aid/Relief, Employment/Labor, Family, Military Authority, Patriotism, Property, Education, Race Relations, Women, American Civil War
